sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"撕裂，扯破"之意。
means: tear ： 最普通用词，指有意或无意地把布或纸等没接缝的材料撕开。可作引申用。
rip ： 侧重指用力把布料等物撕开，也可指用粗暴手段把某物撕裂。
split ： 非正式用词，指有力的切断、劈开或撕裂的动作。

sentence.Network_en: I stared at the man, couldn't tear my eyes away.
sentence.Network_cn: 我盯着那个人看，视线无法移开。

sentence.Network_en: The city will tear down the building and create a park.
sentence.Network_cn: 该市将拆掉这幢大楼，在这儿建个公园。

sentence.Network_en: A muscle tear will leave a scar after healing.
sentence.Network_cn: 肌肉撕裂复原后会留下疤痕。

phrase.cizu_name: tear someone off a strip (或 tear a strip off someo

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)criticize someone or something forcefully or aggressively
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)把…驳得体无完肤；毫不留情地攻击

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)used to express dismay when something unfortunate has happened to disrupt someone's plans
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)这下完蛋了；那就糟了

lj.lj_ly: he was so hurt by her attitude he was nearly in tears.
lj.lj_ls: 她的态度使他大受伤害，几乎快哭出来了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a subject) presented so as to be learned or achieved easily
destroy something, especially good relations between people
jx.jx_cn_mean: 毁坏，破坏（某物，尤指良好关系）

lj.lj_ly: a bloody civil war had torn the country apart.
lj.lj_ls: 血腥的内战毁了这个国家。
别哭了，我已经烦得不行了。

lj.lj_ly: I'll help you find it; I'll tear your house apart if I have to.
lj.lj_ls: 我一定帮你找到它；需要的话，我会把你的屋子翻个底朝天。

jx.jx_en_mean: [often with negative]leave despite a strong desire to stay

lj.lj_ly: she couldn't tear herself away from the view.

jx.jx_cn_mean: 拆卸；拆毁（某物，尤指建筑物）

jx.jx_en_mean: To move about in excited, often angry haste.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 四处狂跑：兴奋地，经常是愤怒地匆忙地走来走去

jx.jx_en_mean: To pull at or attack violently
jx.jx_cn_mean: 撕扯：猛裂地撕扯或进攻

lj.lj_ly: The dog tore at the meat.
Their plight tore at his heart.
lj.lj_ls: 他们的困境让他感到很难过

jx.jx_en_mean: To remove (oneself, for example) unwillingly or reluctantly.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使…勉强地离开：使（例如某人自己）不情愿地或勉强地离开

jx.jx_en_mean: To attack with great vigor or violence
jx.jx_cn_mean: 猛攻：以巨大的勇气或暴力进攻

lj.lj_ly: tore into the food; tore into his opponent.
lj.lj_ls: 抢夺食物；猛攻他的对手

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English teran, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch teren and German zehren, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek derein 'flay'. The noun dates from the early 17th cent
Old English tēar, of Germanic origin; related to German Zähre, from an Indo-European root shared by Old Latin dacruma (Latin lacrima) and Greek dakru

entry.def: Tears are the drops of salty liquid that come out of your eyes when you are crying.

example.ex: I just broke down and wept with tears of joy...
example.tran: 我一下子禁不住喜极而泣。

entry.def: You can use tears in expressions such as in tears ,burst into tears, and close to tears to indicate that someone is crying or is almost crying.

example.ex: He was in floods of tears on the phone...
She burst into tears and ran from the kitchen...
example.tran: 她突然哭了，跑出了厨房。

entry.def: If you tear paper, cloth, or another material, or if it tears, you pull it into two pieces or you pull it so that a hole appears in it.

example.ex: She very nearly tore my overcoat...
example.tran: 她差点把我的大衣扯破了。

example.ex: Mary Ann tore the edge off her napkin...
example.tran: 玛丽·安撕掉了餐巾的边儿。

entry.def: A tear in paper, cloth, or another material is a hole that has been made in it.

example.ex: I peered through a tear in the van's curtains.
example.tran: 我通过篷车帘子的破洞窥视。

entry.def: If something tears your flesh or skin, it cuts it badly.

example.ex: Canine teeth are for piercing and killing prey, and tearing flesh...
example.tran: 犬齿用来咬穿、咬死猎物，还可以撕肉。

example.ex: He had stumbled down and torn the skin from his knees.
example.tran: 他绊倒在地，膝盖上蹭破了皮。

entry.def: If you tear one of your muscles or ligaments, or if it tears, you injure it by accidentally moving it in the wrong way.

example.ex: He tore a muscle in his right thigh...
example.tran: 他右大腿的一块肌肉拉伤了。

example.ex: If the muscle is stretched again it could even tear.
example.tran: 这块肌肉要是再拉伸的话，甚至可能会撕裂。

entry.def: To tear something from somewhere means to remove it roughly and violently.

example.ex: She tore the windscreen wipers from his car...
example.tran: 她猛地扯掉他车上的雨刷。

example.ex: He tore down the girl's photograph, and crumpled it into a ball.
example.tran: 他一把扯下那女孩的照片，将它揉成一团。

entry.def: If a person or animal tears at something, they pull it violently and try to break it into pieces.

example.ex: Female fans fought their way past bodyguards and tore at his clothes.
example.tran: 女粉丝冲破保安的阻拦，撕扯他的衣裳。

entry.def: If you tear somewhere, you move there very quickly, often in an uncontrolled or dangerous way.

example.ex: The door flew open and Miranda tore into the room...
example.tran: 门猛地开了，米兰达闯进房间。

example.ex: Without looking to left or to right, he tore off down the road.
example.tran: 他也不朝两边看，就在路上开始狂奔。

entry.tran: 使饱经创伤;使经受磨难
entry.def: If you say that a place is torn by particular events, you mean that unpleasant events which cause suffering and division among people are happening there.

example.ex: ...a country that has been torn by civil war and foreign invasion since its independence.
example.tran: 自独立以来就饱受内战和外敌入侵之苦的国家

means.word_mean: 1. a drop of the clear salty saline solution secreted by the lacrimal glands;

sentences.sentence: "his story brought tears to her eyes"

means.word_mean: 2. an opening made forcibly as by pulling apart;

sentences.sentence: "there was a rip in his pants"

means.word_mean: 3. an occasion for excessive eating or drinking;

sentences.sentence: "they went on a bust that lasted three days"
"he took the manuscript in both hands and gave it a mighty tear"

means.word_mean: 1. separate or cause to separate abruptly;
2. to separate or be separated by force;

sentences.sentence: "planks were in danger of being torn from the crossbars"

means.word_mean: 5. fill with tears or shed tears;

list.explanation: somebody严厉批评、责骂或口头攻击(某人)

example.en: I don't know why she tore into me. I was at work when the window was broken.
example.zh: 我不明白她为什么冲着我发火。我上班时，那扇窗已经是破的了。

list.explanation: (something) 开始津津有味地吃(某物)

example.en: Jimmy tore into the turkey leg and cleaned it off in no time.
example.zh: 吉米开始津津有味地吃那火鸡腿，不一会儿就把它吃光了。

list.explanation: (some place)匆匆、急急忙忙进入(某处)

example.en: I tore into the office and answered the phone.
example.zh: 我急急忙忙地奔进办公室，接听电店。

auth_sentence.content: Police fired tear gas to break up the violence.
auth_sentence.res_content: Police fired tear gas to break up the violence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Police fired tear gas to break up the violence.

auth_sentence.content: Police fired tear gas to break up the crowds.
auth_sentence.res_content: Police fired tear gas to break up the crowds.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Police fired tear gas to break up the crowds.

auth_sentence.content: Police fired tear gas to break up the confrontation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Police fired tear gas to break up the confrontation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Police fired tear gas to break up the confrontation.

Sentence.sentence: cultural differences often tear apart a family built on romantic love
He tore down the company's main gate.
We can tear apart the great grass cover of the western plains and pour toxic chemicals into the soil until the soil is dead and blows away in the wind.

sentences.en: The child's tears melted his determination.
sentences.cn: 孩子的眼泪使他的决心动摇了。

means.word_mean: 撕, 扯; (使)分裂; 撕碎; 扯破; 戳破

sentences.en: I tore my coat this morning.
sentences.cn: 今天早上我把上衣撕破了。

means.word_mean: 使烦恼; 使痛苦; 深受…之苦的; 饱经…摧残的

sentences.en: The child's misery tore my heart.
sentences.cn: 这小孩的悲惨境遇使我很伤心。

jushi.english: When I told them my story the girls broke into tears.
jushi.chinese: 当我给女孩子们讲了我的身世后,她们都哭起来了。

jushi.english: When she learned the sad news, she found it hard to choke back her tears.
jushi.chinese: 当她得知那个悲痛的消息时,泪水止不住夺眶而出。
